alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cheyenne County through 445 PM MDT... At 400 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Brownson, or 12 miles west of Sidney, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sidney, Colton, Brownson, Sidney Airport and Lorenzo. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 42 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
